title: Script-supporting element
summary: In an HTML document, script-supporting elements are those elements that don't directly contribute to the appearance or layout of the page; instead, they're either scripts or contain information that's only used by scripts.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
